text: The approval of the shareholders of a corporation shall not be required, unless the articles of incorporation otherwise provide, to:
historical:
Legislative History of Laws

For history of Law 18-378, see notes under ยง 29-101.01.

DC CODE ยง 29-310.01

Current through December 11, 2012

sections.text: Sell, lease, exchange, or otherwise dispose of any or all of the corporation's assets in the usual and regular course of business;

Mortgage, pledge, dedicate to the repayment of indebtedness, whether with or without recourse, or otherwise encumber any or all of the corporation's assets, whether or not in the usual and regular course of business;
Transfer any or all of the corporation's assets to one or more corporations or other entities all of the shares or interests of which are owned by the corporation; or
Distribute assets pro rata to the holders of one or more classes or series of the corporation's shares.

heading.catch_text: Disposition of assets not requiring shareholder approval.
